Description: Torso of a roughly modelled terracotta male figure, seated on a slightly protruding thin base. Head, left arm, right forearm, legs and front part of the base are missing. The back is not in an upright position, but is gently reclining. The spine is simply indicated by a smooth vertical groove, the nipples by clay buttons, and the navel by a sunken clay button.
Curator's comments: Clearly the pottery "torso of a seated figure, of rude work, found in the camp" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 74 § 71
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 74 § 71)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.57, p.178, pl.20)
